Key Match Events: Brent Rooker hit a home run in the 7th inning
Seth Brown hit a home run in the 8th inning
Dominic Smith hit a home run in the 8th inning
Osvaldo Bido dominated left-handed hitters, allowing just.154 batting average and.205 slugging percentage
Pre-Game Insights: The Reds are running out of starting pitchers in both the big leagues and in Triple-A.
Fernando Cruz is a left-handed reliever being used as a starter due to lack of available pitchers.
Osvaldo Bido has dominated left-handed hitters, allowing a.154 batting average and.205 slugging percentage.
Post-Match Reflections: The Reds came back from a 5-run deficit in the 7th inning but lost 6-5 in the 9th inning.
The Reds showed some life but still have issues with hitting and pitching.
The Reds are playing poorly and may need to make a move soon.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was postponed due to rain.
The Reds have 6 more games at home followed by 2 more games.
Others: Evan Kravetz was called up from Triple-A Louisville.
Rhett Lowder will start on Friday against Milwaukee.
